question_text: Why is a pair of polarization filters used in standard LCD construction?
answer_options: To increase light output by doubling brightness
To allow modulation of light passing through the liquid crystal layer
To prevent backlight flickering and ghosting
To convert analog signals to digital form
correct_answer: To allow modulation of light passing through the liquid crystal layer
explanation: Polarizers are positioned before and after the liquid crystals to control light flow; alignment determines whether light passes or is blocked.
